Others: Orlando Magic forward Franz Wagner scored 27 points to lead the team to a 115-88 victory over the injury-depleted New Orleans Pelicans.
Brandon Boston Jr. scored 26 points for New Orleans, while Jose Alvarado added 21 points, five rebounds, and five assists.
The Magic never trailed in the game and broke a five-game losing streak.
New Orleans was missing six of its top eight scorers, including Zion Williamson, who was ruled out due to a tight left hamstring.
The Magic won for the 10th straight time at home, going back to March 30 and including the postseason.
The Magic are 2-14 on the road in that span.
The Pelicans lost for the seventh time in eight games.
The Magic converted six dunks, six layups, and four 3-pointers in the first 18 minutes, allowing them to take a 24-point lead.
The Pelicans made a 17-1 run that cut the lead to 10.
Jalen Suggsâ€™ 3-pointer with 8:36 left in the third quarter ended a stretch of more than nine minutes in which the Magic did not make a field goal.
The Pelicans return home to face Brooklyn on Monday night. The Magic host Washington on Sunday night.
